Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver physically intervened by grabbing a child to thwart the child's behavior.
Correction Narrative: A voluntary corrective action plan was submitted ensuring that the operation addressed all concerns regarding disciplinary measures. Staff were canceled and revised on consistent behavior techniques that align with the operations model and promises. Staff will meet with the PD and clinical director 1 on 1 monthly, and house parents will receive monthly check-ins.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff did not complete annual normalcy training timely.
Correction Narrative: The training coordinator audited the normalcy training for all active employees and the software update triggers. The employee of concerns completed and submitted their normalcy training on 5/16/25.

Deficiency Narrative: One children's rights record was not signed timely within 7 days of admission indicating  that the rights were not reviewed.
Correction Narrative: The GRO will ensure a signed copy of childrens rights will be in the childrens files within 7 days. The operation will perform quarterly peer reviews. All client files will be audited for errors. A memo will be added to the files as a part of the corrective action plan. The PD reviewed this information with all case managers to ensure that this information is in the admission packet.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was administered medication prescribed to another child in care.
Correction Narrative:
A voluntary corrective action plan was submitted by the Administrator sating that the involved caregivers were verbally counseled on the importance of being alert, and aware while administering prescribed and over the counter medications to children in care. The caregivers were required to take additional training on psychotropic medications and basic medical.
I review the medication logs and storage at the time of this inspection, no concerns were identified.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver admitted to sleeping when being the only caregiver on duty.
Correction Narrative: A caregiver admitted to sleeping when being the only caregiver on duty.

Deficiency Narrative: Two cottages inspected had shower mold, door damage, splitting around door knob, and snack trash under a child s bed.
Correction Narrative: The operation met compliance by submitting photos of the cited repairs and a Voluntary Corrective Action plan.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver knowingly failed to report sexual abuse to the Child Abuse Hotline which allowed sexualized contact to continue be exhibited toward children by two caregiver(s) at the operation.
Correction Narrative:
(Inspection# 393422): A physical follow up inspection was conducted on 3/7/2023 in correlation with the action plan submitted. A walk through of the cottages were conducted to ensure that the alleged personnel was no longer on the property. Records of the alleged personnel were reviewed to clarify the alleged personnels termination dates. Discussions, amongst the administration and myself was conducted regarding the corrective action plan that was submitted. The administration explained in in detail how they will continue to implement the action plan to prevent any future risk. 

The operation created internal methods for children and adults to anonymously report concerns, or the violation of children's rights. The operation provided trainings on how to recognize, and reporting abuse, neglect, sexual misconduct, and responding to suspected behaviors. The operation provided trainings on identifying reportable incidents and the importance of timely manner.

Deficiency Narrative: During the course of the investigation, it was determined that two operational caregiver(s) did not use proper judgement and did not demonstrate self-control in the presence of the children by engaging in inappropriate sexualized contact and behavior with six children in care.
Correction Narrative:
(Inspection# 393422): A physical follow up inspection was conducted on 3/7/2023 in correlation with the action plan submitted. A walk through of the cottages were conducted to ensure that the alleged personnel was no longer on the property. Records of the alleged personnel were reviewed to clarify the alleged personnels termination dates. Discussions, amongst the administration and myself was conducted regarding the corrective action plan that was submitted. The administration explained in in detail how they will continue to implement the action plan to prevent any future risk.   

Staff are required to review their job descriptions and children's rights at least one time a year. The intent of these requirements is to ensure competency, prudent judgment, and self-control of staff always.

Deficiency Narrative: Six children in care at the operation, both males and females, ages 5-14 years old were subjected to ongoing sexualized contact by a caregiver.  Additionally, a caregiver failed to intervene to prevent the sexualized contact from occurring at the childcare operation.
Correction Narrative:
(Inspection# 393422): A physical follow up inspection was conducted on 3/7/2023 in correlation with the action plan submitted. A walk through of the cottages were conducted to ensure that the alleged personnel was no longer on the property. Records of the alleged personnel were reviewed to clarify the alleged personnels termination dates. Discussions, amongst the administration and myself was conducted regarding the corrective action plan that was submitted. The administration explained in in detail how they will continue to implement the action plan to prevent any future risk.   

The corrective action plan stated that all staff are required to review children's rights. The operation has reposted the children's rights posters in all cottages making them more visible. The operation installed cameras in the common area of the cottages to assist with unannounced supervision.

Deficiency Narrative: Caregiver did not provide a child in care with appropriate supervision when the child with high-risk behavior history was able to access and ingest medication without the caregiver's knowledge.
Correction Narrative: Administrator submitted a Safety Plan with supervision implementation for child in care. All required information is documented completely to describe how the child will be supervised by staff during awake and sleeping hours.

Deficiency Narrative: A 13 year child ingested over the counter medication and self reported the ingestion.  Caregiver required to provide supervision was unaware of the child's activity and access to medication.
Correction Narrative:
The Administrator submitted the BGC previsions for the staff person. It is clearly stated how staff will be utilized while at the operation until further notice. The staff will be accompanied by other staff always and never left alone with any child in care at any time. 

Providing more staff, Service Plan changes, and internal adjustments will increase awareness of children in care. During the follow up inspection is was demonstrated how the supervision changes are being implemented.

Deficiency Narrative: Child was able to access medication due to the medication being unlocked or the child having access to the medication keys.
Correction Narrative: A follow inspection was conducted, photos were taken. The operation has replaced all doors were the medication is locked and stored. Applying automatic locking doors and enforcing all staff to keep all operation keys on the staff person always.
